data.actual_result: The client tries to do everything at the same time and may produce conflicts, causing weird toasts to appear such as "only one channel can have a parent_id modified at a time". Usually when those errors show up your channels won't be sorted properly at the end
data.expected_result: The client should queue your actions properly, so everything is sorted fine at the end, even if you have to wait for quite a while since your internet is slow
data.short_description: Sorting multiple channels by moving them to different categories while you have a weak connection may cause weird errors to show up
data.steps_to_repro: - Go to your mobile data settings of your Android device and select option to force 2G. This is the best way to simulate a weak connection.  - Open Server Settings > Channels - Select either text or voice sorting mode (personally it occured more often when sorting voice channels, but that might be just me)  - Try to sort several channels successively by moving them into different categories. Try to be as quick as possible (without making it a destructive behavior either) : move another channel as soon as you released your finger to move a channel
